result.execSummary:
The disposition of "Other" is used to indicate several different dispositions. The Charge(s)/Sentence(s) and Court Record Events sections of the WCCA record display additional information that must be reviewed in order to determine the exact disposition of the charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick R Johnson

defendant.name: Johnson, Derrick R
defendant.address: P O Box 3530, c/o Oshkosh Correctional Institution, Oshkosh, WI 54903

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Derrick R Johnson in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Derrick R Johnson in custody.  Anthony Prekop appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cuyler hearing.  Request for detainer from PA for transport for defendant to testify.  No objections.  Court grants detainer.

Copy of letter from District Attorney of Lancaster County, PA to Warden Smith of Oshkosh Correctional Institution with attached copies of Agreement on Detainers: Form V (Request for Temporary Custody), Arrest Warrant, Defendant ID Information, Criminal Complaint information, and Agreement on Detainers: Form I (Notice of Untried Indictment, Information or Complaint and of Right to Request Disposition)
